intro: Clavija procera, commonly known as the tall clavija, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its hollow, cylindrical stems. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and often have a mild aromatic scent. Clavija procera is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and forest edges.
